title: Number of registered voters in the United States 1996 to 2018
yAxis: Number of registered voters in millions
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Number of registered voters in millions, with a total of 9 data points. The chart has 6 significant trends.
The longest trend is moderately positive which exists from 2008 to 1996.
Also, the next significant trend is slightly negative which exists from 2018 to 2016.
Differently, the next significant trend is extremely positive which exists from 2016 to 2014.
In a similar manner, the next significant trend is slightly negative which exists from 2014 to 2012.
On the other hand, the next significant trend is extremely positive which exists from 2012 to 2010.
Additionally, the next significant trend is slightly negative which exists from 2010 to 2008.
gold: In 2018 , there were 153.07 million people registered to vote in the United States . Although this was an increase from 1996 , when 127.66 million people were registered to vote , it 's lower than the peak of 157.6 million registered voters in 2016 . Voting requirements While voting laws differ from state to state , the basic requirements are the same across the entire country .
